title.narrative: Emergency support to improve health condition to drought/AWD affected IDPs and host communities in Belet Weyne district through Reliable Safe Water Sources and Promote Sustainable Sanitation and Hygiene practices.

description.narrative: Under this project, WARDI proposes to improve access to safe water, sanitation facilities and services and promote good hygiene practices in an effort to improve the health status of 25,200 drought/AWD affected communities and internally displaced men, women, boys and girls in Belet Weyne district of Hiran region of south Somalia. Lack of access to safe and adequate water and sanitation facilities coupled with poor hygiene knowledge and practices puts these communities at risk for waterborne diseases and loss of life. Key activities that WARDI would like to implement in the target locations include: WATER: Provision of life saving water through rehabilitation of 30 shallow wells (25 with hand pumps, 2 with pump powered with generator and 3 with pump powered with solar) construction of 4 water kiosks supplied water through piping system rehabilitation of Osman Bin Afan orphanage center WASH facilities, capacity building training to 28 WASH committees and well 56 operators on operation and maintenance. SANITATION: To improve the sanitation of the IDP camps and schools WARDI will construct 6 twin block latrines in Bidhaan school and an Orphanage center construct 205 IDP latrines install 4 FSM sites and systems and finally distribute 52 sanitation sets to 13 IDP camps in Belet Weyne town. HYGIENE: WARDI will train 20 Community Mobilizers to carry out comprehensive hygiene promotion campaign to educate the community better hygiene promotion practices including hand washing with soap practices through visiting house-to-house, schools, feeding/nutrition centers and health centers in this project, UNICEF will supply from regional supply hub1000 hygiene kits and WARDI will distribute the kits to 1000 households and IDPs who are at risk of AWD/cholera and malnutrition diseases The proposed response took into consideration the impact of the drought on women, and children in terms of access to WASH services it proposed specific actions to prevent risk of gender based violence and hence will contribute to greater gender equality.
